string-array.item: Just Blank...there are reasons...leave first entry blank in values

string-array.name: conditionGlossaryValues
string-array.item: Not used...but the order of these values must match the order of the keys above
You take the specified amount and type of damage at the start of your turn.

You grant combat advantage. You can only take one action: either a standard, move or minor action (but as many free actions as you like). You can\'t take immediate or opportunity actions. You can\'t flank.
You grant combat advantage. You can take any actions except actions that are designated as \'No Action\'. You can\'t flank.
You take a -2 penalty to attack roles if you don\'t target the creature that marked you.
Your speed is decreased to 2. This applies to all forms of movement that you have but does not affect forced movement.
You can\'t move but you can be pushed, pulled or slid and you can teleport.
You grant combat advantage. You take a -2 penalty to all attack rolls. You can\'t move but you can teleport. You can NOT be pushed, pulled or slid.
You are dazed. The dominating creature chooses your one action. The only powers it can make you use are at-will powers.
Your attacks deal half damage (add everything up and then halve it). This does NOT affect any ongoing damage that you deal.
You grant combat advantage. You can\'t see any target (they have total concealment, giving you a -5 to attack if you know where to attack). You take a -10 to Perception. You can\'t flank.
You grant combat advantage. You can be hit with a coup de grace.
You are turned to stone. You are unaware of your surroundings, don\'t age, can\'t take actions, and resist 20 to all damage.
You can\'t move but you can be pushed, pulled or slid and you can teleport.

You grant combat advantage to those making melee attacks. You have a -2 penalty to attack rolls. You get a +2 bonus to all defenses vs. ranged attacks from non-adjacent enemies. You are lying on the ground. If you are flying, you safely descend a distance equal to your speed; if you are still in the air, you fall the remaining distance.
You grant combat advantage and have a -5 penalty to all defenses. You can be the subject of a coup de grace. You fall prone. You can\'t provide flanking. You can\'t take any actions.
